questao.pergunta: Put in the correct order the following events from a JSP’s lifecycle.
How is a scriplet defined? (1 correct answer)
How is a directive defined? (1 correct answer)
How is an expression defined? (1 correct answer)
How is a declaration defined? (1 correct answer)
Which of the following is syntactically valid? (1 correct answer)
Which of the following is syntactically valid? (1 correct answer)
Which of the following are syntactically valid? (2 correct answers)
The following are all attributes of the page directive. (1 correct answer) ⇒ import ⇒ errorPage ⇒ contentType ⇒ isErrorPage ⇒ isELignored ⇒ isThreadSafe

The following are all implicit objects of a JSP. (1 correct answer)
⇒ out
⇒ config
⇒ session
⇒ request
⇒ response
⇒ application
⇒ exception ⇒ pageContext ⇒ page

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= session == pageContext.getSession() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= request == pageContext.getRequest() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= response == pageContext.getResponse() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= config == pageContext.getServletConfig() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= application == session.getServletContext() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= application == pageContext.getServletContext() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= application == request.getSession().getServletContext() %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= page instanceof JspPage %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<%= out instanceof JspWriter %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= session.getAttribute("name") %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= session.getAttribute("Diogenes") %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= pageContext.getAttribute("name") %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= pageContext.getAttribute("name", pageContext.APPLICATION_SCOPE) %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= pageContext.getAttribute("name", pageContext.SESSION_SCOPE) %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= pageContext.findAttribute("name") %>

What is the output of the following code? (1 correct answer)
<% session.setAttribute("name", "Diogenes"); %> <%= pageContext.SESSION_SCOPE == pageContext.getAttributesScope("name") %>

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello <%= request.getAttribute("yourname")%> !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello <%= request.getParameter("yourname")%> !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello <%= request.getParameter("OK")%> !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="yourname" value="Bond"/> <input type="submit" name="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <html> <body> Hello <%= request.getParameter("submit")%> !! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods }
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="about" value="Mathematics"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <jsp:useBean id="book" class="library.Book" scope="request" /> <html> <body> I like <jsp:getProperty name="book" property="title" />! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

Consider this code.
package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods }
<%-- input.jsp --%> <html> <body> <form action="output.jsp"> <input type="text" name="about" value="Mathematics"/> <input type="submit" value="OK" /> </form> </body> </html>
<%-- output.jsp --%> <jsp:useBean id="book" class="library.Book" scope="request" /> <jsp:setProperty name="book" property="title" param="title" /> <html> <body> I like <jsp:getProperty name="book" property="title" />! </body> </html>
What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

alternativas.alternativa: An exception is thrown at runtime.

alternativas.alternativa: I like Head First Servlets and JSP!

questao.pergunta: Consider this code. package library; public class Book { private String title; public Book() {} // get and set methods } <%-- input.jsp --%> click here <%-- output.jsp --%> I like <%= book.getTitle() %>! What is the output when the form is submitted? (1 correct answer)

alternativas.alternativa: An Exception is thrown at runtime

questao.pergunta:
Consider this code and that there is no attribute in the request object.
package value; public class Person { public String name; }
<%-- hello.jsp --%> <html> <body> <jsp:useBean id="person" class="value.Person" scope="request"> <jsp:setProperty name="person" property="name" value="Niko" /> </jsp:useBean> Hello ${person.name}!! </body> </html>
What is the output of hello.jsp? (1 correct answer)

questao.pergunta: Both HttpJspPage and JspPage are interfaces. (1 correct answer)
HttpJspPage IS-A JspPage. (1 correct answer)
HttpJspPage IS-A Servlet. (1 correct answer)
What is the signature of method _jspService of HttpJspPage? (1 correct answer)
The method _jspService of HttpJspPage should not be overriden by a JSP author. (1 correct answer)

alternativas.alternativa: void jspInit(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) throws IOException, ServletException

questao.pergunta: What is the signature of method jspInit of JspPage? (1 correct answer)

alternativas.alternativa: void jspDestroy(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) throws IOException, ServletException

questao.pergunta: What is the signature of method jspDestroy of JspPage? (1 correct answer)
The methods jspInit and jspDestroy of JspPage may be overriden by a JSP author. (1 correct answer)
Both PageContext and JspContext are abstract classes. (1 correct answer)
PageContext IS-A JspContext. (1 correct answer)
The following are all methods of JspContext. (1 correct answer) ⇒ findAttribute() ⇒ getAttribute() ⇒ setAttribute() ⇒ removeAttribute() ⇒ getAttributeNamesInScope() ⇒ getAttributesScope() ⇒ getOut()
Which of the following methods of JspContext have 2 overloaded versions? (3 correct answers)
What is the signature of the method getOut of JspContext? (1 correct answer)
The following are all methods of PageContext. (1 correct answer) ⇒ getPage() ⇒ getSession() ⇒ getRequest() ⇒ getResponse() ⇒ getServletConfig() ⇒ getServletContext()
The following are all fields of PageContext. (1 correct answer) ⇒ PAGE_SCOPE ⇒ REQUEST_SCOPE ⇒ SESSION_SCOPE ⇒ APPLICATION_SCOPE
